parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "Slurm",
  "details": {
    "scheduler": "Slurm",
    "cluster": "faculty",
    "qos": "adamw",
    "partition": "adamw",
    "job_name": "EMMA model slurm_verbose_1day.sbatch",
    "nodes": 1,
    "tasks": 1,
    "memory": "160G",
    "cpu_type": "INTEL",
    "time": "24:00:00",
    "mail_user": "bmaitner@gmail.com",
    "mail_type": "begin, end",
    "output_file": "emma_model_verbose.out",
    "container_runtime": "Singularity",
    "container_image": "AdamWilsonLab-emma_docker-latest.sif",
    "container_bind_points": [
      "/panasas/scratch/grp-adamw/:/panasas/scratch/grp-adamw/",
      "/panasas/scratch/grp-adamw/$USER/singularity/tmp:/tmp",
      "/panasas/scratch/grp-adamw/$USER/singularity/run:/run"
    ],
    "container_home": "/projects/academic/adamw/users/$USER/emma_model",
    "executed_script": "run_verbose.sh"
  }
}
```

The script uses Slurm as a scheduler to manage resources and execute the job. It allocates one node with one task, 160 GB of memory, and runs on INTEL CPUs for a maximum of 24 hours. It also uses Singularity to run a containerized environment based on the image "AdamWilsonLab-emma_docker-latest.sif". The script binds several directories within the container to corresponding directories on the host system. It runs the script "run_verbose.sh" inside the containerized environment.
